Operation 'ListEngagementQualityScore' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Get Engagement Quality Scores' is too generic and doesn't clarify whose scores are being retrieved. Description is comprehensive but lacks clarity on required parameters and authentication. Improved summary specifies this retrieves the authenticated account's scores. Enhanced description clarifies authentication requirement, parameter usage, response schema references (SeqScore, SeqMetrics), the 1-5 scoring scale, and asynchronous processing behavior for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This operation allows you to retrieve your SendGrid Engagement Quality (SEQ) scores for a specified date range**.
A successful request with this API operation will return either a `200` or `202` response.
### 202
This operation returns a `202` response when SendGrid does not yet have scores available for the specified date range. Scores are calculated asynchronously from requests to this endpoint. This means a score may be available for the specified date at a later time, but a score is not available at the time of your API request.
### 200
A 200 response will include all available scores beginning on the `from` and ending on the `to` dates specified. The `score` and `metrics` properties will be omitted from the response for any days in which the user is not eligible to receive a score.
The `score` property represents a user's overall engagement quality. The `metrics` property provides additional scores for the input categories that contribute to that overall score. All scores range from `1` to `5` with a higher number representing better engagement quality.
See [**SendGrid Engagement Quality Overview**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/sendgrid-engagement-quality-api/overview) for more information
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve SEQ scores for authenticated account
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves your SendGrid Engagement Quality (SEQ) scores for a specified date range. Requires authentication via API key. Returns a 200 response with SeqScore objects containing overall engagement quality scores (1-5 scale) and detailed SeqMetrics for contributing factors. Returns a 202 response when scores are still being calculated asynchronously; scores may become available later. The `score` and `metrics` properties are omitted for dates where the account is ineligible for scoring. Use the `from` and `to` date parameters to define the score retrieval period.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get Engagement Quality Scores' is too generic and doesn't clarify whose scores are being retrieved. Description is comprehensive but lacks clarity on required parameters and authentication. Improved summary specifies this retrieves the authenticated account's scores. Enhanced description clarifies authentication requirement, parameter usage, response schema references (SeqScore, SeqMetrics), the 1-5 scoring scale, and asynchronous processing behavior for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ListSubuserEngagementQualityScore' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Original summary lacks specificity about scope (all subusers) and doesn't clarify the account hierarchy context. Description mentions 'specific date' but parameters suggest date range support. Improved summary clarifies this retrieves scores for all subusers under the authenticated account. Enhanced description specifies parent/reseller account context, clarifies date range parameters, references SeqScore and SeqMetrics schemas, and explains the 1-5 scoring scale for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation versus the account-level endpoint.

data.current_description:
**This operation allows you to retrieve SendGrid Engagement Quality (SEQ) scores for your Subusers or customer accounts for a specific date.**
A successful request with this API operation will return either a `200` or `202` response.
### 202
This operation returns a `202` response when SendGrid does not yet have scores available for the specified date range. Scores are calculated asynchronously from requests to this endpoint. This means a score may be available for the specified date at a later time, but a score is not available at the time of your API request.
### 200
A `200` response will include scores for all Subusers or customer accounts belonging to the requesting parent or reseller account. The `score` and `metrics` properties will be omitted from the response if a Subuser or customer account is not eligible to receive a score for the specified date.
The `score` property represents a Subuser or customer account's overall engagement quality. The `metrics` property provides additional scores for the input categories that contribute to that overall score. All scores range from `1` to `5` with a higher number representing better engagement quality.
See [**SendGrid Engagement Quality Overview**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/sendgrid-engagement-quality-api/overview) for more information
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve SEQ scores for all subuser accounts
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves SendGrid Engagement Quality (SEQ) scores for all Subusers or customer accounts under the authenticated parent or reseller account for a specified date. Requires parent/reseller account authentication. Returns a 200 response with SeqScore objects for each Subuser containing overall engagement quality scores (1-5 scale) and SeqMetrics for contributing factors. Returns a 202 response when scores are still being calculated asynchronously. The `score` and `metrics` properties are omitted for Subusers ineligible for scoring on the specified date. Use the `from` and `to` date parameters to define the score retrieval period.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about scope (all subusers) and doesn't clarify the account hierarchy context. Description mentions 'specific date' but parameters suggest date range support. Improved summary clarifies this retrieves scores for all subusers under the authenticated account. Enhanced description specifies parent/reseller account context, clarifies date range parameters, references SeqScore and SeqMetrics schemas, and explains the 1-5 scoring scale for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation versus the account-level endpoint.
